segments.text: I see the water just pouring over the sink, and it’s getting everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing right in it, but she’s not even reacting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so clever, sneaking those cookies while she’s distracted.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think it’s funny how the boy is balancing on that stool, like he’s some kind of acrobat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting so patiently, like she knows he’ll share with her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is like a comedy, with the water and the kids and the woman not noticing anything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever turn around and see what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading fast, but she’s still just drying that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like laughing at how ridiculous this all is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and it’s going to be so dramatic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I love how the garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR
